alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 2:50PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Significant Wind, Blowing Snow, and Whiteout Impacts Expected Tonight into Wednesday... .A winter storm is on track to bring accumulating snow and strong winds to the region beginning late this evening and persisting through Wednesday morning before conditions slowly improve into the afternoon. Winds will gust to 45 mph across much of the area from late tonight through Wednesday morning, with some higher gusts to 50 mph at times west of the Mississippi River. Combined with falling snow, these strong winds will lead to significant reductions in visibility with whiteout conditions at times, especially in rural, open areas. Wind-prone areas of southeast Minnesota will be especially susceptible to prolonged poor visibility and strong winds, which led to a Blizzard Warning upgrade for that area. Accumulating snow will be highest north of I-94 where 3 to 6 inches is generally expected, though winds will be a bit lighter over north-central WI. Generally 1 to 3" expected between I-90 and I-94 with an inch or less south of I-90. There will be travel impacts, including the Wednesday morning commute. Plan now and be prepared to adjust travel if conditions warrant it. Isolated power outages will be possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow with total accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause blowing snow and near whiteout conditions at times in open areas. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
